result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Scott M. Moherek in court.  Attorney Gregory Bates in court for Scott M. Moherek.  Prosecuting attorney Drew Lehman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 09:45 am.

1:24 PM
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Greg Bates. Clerk JT  Minutes: Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:45 am. Bond continued as previously set. ec
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

09:03 AM Defendant, Scott M. Moherek, appeared.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:    SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney. DE indicates he may also retain private counsel.    DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  *No Weapons especially firearms,  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Akrum B

200PM    Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Chad Shamali.    Clerk JT Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner onAugust 2, 2022 at 9:00 AM. $3000 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).   ts
